  * P:Played,  W:Win,  L:Loss,  T:Tie,  NR:No Results,  NRR:Net Run Rate,  PTS:Points
  * Win:2 points,  Tie, No Result or abandoned:1 point,  Loss:0 point


In the T20 World Cup, or any other competition involving multiple teams, the points table plays a crucial role. The winning team typically receives two points, while the losing team gets none. The top teams in the points table ultimately qualify for the semi-finals and final matches. 
After the T20 World Cup 1 match, India currently sits at the top of the table with the highest number of points (2). India has played a total of 1 matches so far, winning 1 and losing 0. Their net run rate stands at +1.450. 
In second place is Pakistan with 2 points. Pakistan has played 1 matches, winning 1 and losing 0. The remaining teams in the points table are Netherlands, USA, Namibia. 
With the T20 World Cup 2026 gaining momentum, every match is now having a direct impact on the points table, intensifying the race for the playoffs. A single win or loss can significantly alter team positions, making consistency more important than ever. The upcoming fixtures will be decisive, especially for teams hovering around the mid-table as they push to secure a top-four spot. For those struggling at the bottom (Netherlands, USA, Namibia, Ireland), each game presents an opportunity to revive their campaign and stay in contention. 
The T20 World Cup will feature a total of 20 teams in the upcoming edition, setting the stage for a highly competitive tournament. The teams have been divided into four groups—Group A, Group B, Group C, and Group D—with five teams in each group. 
Group A comprises India, Namibia, the Netherlands, Pakistan, and the United States. Group B includes Australia, Ireland, Oman, Sri Lanka, and Zimbabwe. In Group C, Scotland, England, Italy, Nepal, and the West Indies will compete for supremacy, while Group D features Afghanistan, Canada, New Zealand, South Africa, and the United Arab Emirates. 
With a diverse mix of established powerhouses and emerging teams across all four groups, the T20 World Cup is expected to deliver closely contested matches, as teams battle for crucial points and a place in the knockout stages.

FAQ'S
##  [How does the T20 World Cup 2026 points table work?](https://www.indiatoday.in/sports/cricket/t20-world-cup/points-table#accordion-1)
In the T20 World Cup, the points system works as follows:
A team earns 2 points for a win.
If a match is tied, each team gets 1 point.
The top two teams from each group advance to the Super 8 stage.
##  [How many teams are participating in the T20 World Cup 2026?](https://www.indiatoday.in/sports/cricket/t20-world-cup/points-table#accordion-2)
20 teams are participating in the T20 World Cup 2026.
##  [What if two teams have the same points in the T20 World Cup 2026?](https://www.indiatoday.in/sports/cricket/t20-world-cup/points-table#accordion-3)
The team with the higher net run rate will be placed higher in the table.
##  [How many groups are in the T20 World Cup 2026?](https://www.indiatoday.in/sports/cricket/t20-world-cup/points-table#accordion-4)
There are four groups:
Group A: India, Pakistan, USA, Namibia, Netherlands
Group B: Australia, Sri Lanka, Zimbabwe, Ireland, Oman
Group C: England, West Indies, Scotland, Italy, Nepal
Group D: South Africa, New Zealand, Afghanistan, Canada, UAE
##  [Which team has won the most T20 World Cup titles?](https://www.indiatoday.in/sports/cricket/t20-world-cup/points-table#accordion-5)
India, West Indies and England have each won the ICC Men's T20 World Cup twice, making them the most successful teams in the tournament's history.
##  [Who won the first T20 World Cup?](https://www.indiatoday.in/sports/cricket/t20-world-cup/points-table#accordion-6)
India won the first T20 World Cup in 2007.
##  [Which edition of the T20 World Cup is taking place in 2026?](https://www.indiatoday.in/sports/cricket/t20-world-cup/points-table#accordion-7)
This is the tenth edition.
##  [When and where is the T20 World Cup 2026 final?](https://www.indiatoday.in/sports/cricket/t20-world-cup/points-table#accordion-8)
The T20 World Cup final is scheduled for March 8, 2026, in Ahmedabad/Colombo.
The [T20 World Cup](https://www.indiatoday.in/sports/cricket/t20-world-cup) format remains unchanged from the 2024 edition, with 20 teams divided into four groups of five. The top two teams from each group will advance to the Super Eight stage, with group placements determined by predetermined seedings.
Group A includes India, Namibia, the Netherlands, Pakistan and the USA. Group B comprises Australia, Ireland, Oman, Sri Lanka and Zimbabwe, while Group C features Scotland, England, Italy, Nepal and the West Indies. Group D, meanwhile, consists of Afghanistan, Canada, New Zealand, South Africa and the UAE. With a strong mix of established sides and emerging teams, the tournament is expected to deliver several closely contested encounters.
The points table at the T20 World Cup 2026 is determined by a team’s results in the group stage, with two points awarded for a win and no points for a defeat, while abandoned or tied matches due to rain see both teams receive one point each. Team standings are ranked primarily on points, followed by net run rate (NRR) and, if required, head-to-head records. As a result, weather-affected matches can have a direct impact on the points table, making every game and even small margins crucial in shaping the qualification race.
